Member since: October 08, 2009 Total points: 5,081 (Level 5) Add Contact Block Fast food hardly as any dishes, because everything is paper and cardboard. However, there are still trays and cooking equipment that need washing.
I was a dishwasher in several real restaurants for a few years. You'll be working cleaning towers of dishes, cooking equipment, empty fryers, help cooking sometimes, and might even bus a table a few times.
Often your working later that ANY of the chefs.
Personally I think working at a Old Folks Home is the way too go, because of the health benefits that go with it and the hours are usually more that of a normal job.
You can expect to make minimum wage, usually no more than that. Even at a 5 star restaurant. Sometimes though the dishwashers and waiters share tips, but this is RARE. If you have a cool boss sometimes they will have tones of soda cans you could recycle for extra money. A few restaurants I worked at didn't have the time to take care of them. So I did it for them and made about $50 extra a week.
Some scummy restaurants will pay you under the table, which I honestly would avoid. If the owner can't do things by the law its only a mater of time before they are caught and your out of a job. Plus you won't get a real job reference, no taxes back at the end of the year, and usually pays less. 2 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes by WickedGo...
